examples.sentence: "Ta!" said the little boy when receiving his ice cream.
She gave me a thumbs-up with a cheerful "Ta!"
The technician installed a TA to connect legacy devices.
This TA model supports 128Kbps transmission speed.
Press tab to jump between form fields like a digital kangaroo.
Python coders hate when tabs and spaces mix like oil and water.
He collects Coca-Cola tabs to make anti-cancer armor (urban legend alert!).
The satisfying 'psst' sound when pulling the tab is 80% of soda's charm.
My KTV tab was longer than the Great Wall after ordering 10 durian pizzas.
In ancient pubs, they kept tabs by chalking on wooden boards - the original cloud computing.
Her browser has 107 taobao tabs open like a digital hoarder.
The protein powder jar has a scary 'muscle explosion' tab that nobody reads.
Moms keep tabs on kids' WeChat steps better than the NSA.
CEO said he'd pick up the tab but 'forgot' his Alipay password - classic rich people problem.
The secret to my grandma's dumplings is three drops of Tabasco.
His face turned redder than Tabasco sauce after eating Sichuan hotpot.
These Tabasco peppers are so hot they could power a rocket.
Her qipao was made of shimmering tabby silk.
Ancient merchants traded tabby fabrics along the Silk Road.
The orange tabby is sunbathing on my keyboard again.
Tabby cats account for 80% of stray cat populations.
The craftsman tabbied the metal surface with special tools.
Morning dew tabbied the spider's web into a glittering net.
This tabby weave creates breathable summer fabric.
The tabby water surface reflected dancing light.
That viral tabby cat has 2 million followers on Douyin.
Migrant workers built tabernacles from plastic sheets near the construction site.
The festival organizers set up colorful tabernacles for vendors along the street.
Bedouin tabernacles blend perfectly with the desert landscape.
We pitched a tabernacle by the West Lake during the camping trip.
The traveling preacher held services in a makeshift tabernacle.
Mormons call their meeting houses 'tabernacles'.
The relic was tabernacled in a golden casket at the Shaolin Temple.
Ancient Egyptians tabernacled mummies in elaborately decorated sarcophagi.
The soul tabernacles in the mortal body according to Christian belief.
Migratory birds tabernacle in this wetland every winter.
During the Feast of Tabernacles, Jewish families build temporary shelters in their yards.

examples.sentence: The mahjong table collapsed after 8 hours of intense gameplay.
She doodled pandas on the conference table during boring meetings.
The hotpot ingredients covered the entire round table.
The Excel table automatically calculates your daily milk tea expenses.
The Tibetan tableland is called 'the roof of the world'.
They tabled the meeting to watch the World Cup final.
The teacher tabled students' dumpling-eating speed rankings.
The underdog team turned the tables with a last-minute three-pointer.
WFH policy is finally on the table after the subway strike.

examples.sentence: The lantern festival created a magical tableau with thousands of lights.
Her WeChat moments are always a tableau of gourmet food and sunsets.
The debate stage became a tableau of political tension.
The family reunion dinner turned into a tableau of generational conflict.
The museum presented a living tableau of ancient tea ceremony.

examples.sentence: The red tablecloth with dragon patterns made the hotpot feast more festive.
She spilled mapo tofu on the new linen tablecloth.
Restaurants change tablecloths faster than TikTok trends refresh.
The Tibetan tableland is known as the Roof of the World.
Wild yaks roam freely across this vast tableland.
Grandma's secret recipe requires exactly 3 tablespoons of soy sauce.
The influencer measured coffee with a silver tablespoon in her morning vlog.
Kids nowadays learn pinyin on Huawei tablets instead of paper.
Her iPad tablet slipped into hot pot during dinner.
The golden tablet on Forbidden City gates shines under sunset.
We couldn't find the restaurant until seeing its stone tablet.
Traditional Chinese doctors still write prescriptions on paper tablets.
Students use calligraphy tablets to practice æ­£æ¥·å­—.
The Lianhua Qingwen tablet is wrapped in gold foil.
She mistook vitamin tablets for M&M's chocolates.
The Terracotta Warriors were discovered by farmers digging near a stone tablet.
Archaeologists found ancient writing tablets in Dunhuang caves.

examples.sentence: The cat knocked over a teacup, leaving circular stains on the wooden tabletop.
AR technology can turn your tabletop into a virtual battlefield.
During lockdown, tabletop games became our family's new happy hour.
The new tabletop game combines mahjong tiles with RPG elements.
The bride received 12 sets of rose-gold tableware as wedding gifts.
Disposable tableware is forbidden in Shanghai's waste sorting policy.
The antique silver tableware shone under the chandelier.
Her Japanese tableware set includes chopsticks with cherry blossom patterns.
The tabloid claimed aliens were dining at a hotpot restaurant in Chongqing.
Celebrity breakups always dominate tabloid headlines.
Aviation tabloids often feature stunning aerial photos of the Himalayas.
This antique tabloid documented Shanghai's 1930s fashion trends.
The doctor prescribed white tabloids shaped like mini steamed buns.
Ancient tabloids made from herbs were discovered in the Mawangdui tombs.
Readers' Digest is the most famous tabloid in the publishing industry.
This AI-generated tabloid summarizes trending Weibo topics every hour.
The tabloid report about pandas opening a bubble tea shop went viral.
His tabloid confession shocked the entire entertainment industry.
The tabloid version of the government work report fits on a napkin.
She gave a tabloid introduction to Confucianism using just three emojis.
Tabloid journalism thrives on celebrity scandals and UFO sightings.
The professor explained quantum physics in tabloid form using crayon drawings.
Eating pork is a taboo in some religions.
The word 'death' became a taboo during Chinese New Year.
The sacred mountain is taboo for women in their tradition.
The CEO's private elevator is taboo for regular employees.
In China, giving clocks as gifts is considered taboo.
The documentary explores taboo topics in conservative societies.
The school taboos chewing gum in classrooms.
Many cultures taboo whistling at night due to superstitions.
The film broke the taboo on discussing mental health in Asia.
Salary is often a taboo subject among Chinese colleagues.

examples.sentence: The research data was presented in tabular form with emoji frequency statistics.
His WeChat expenses were neatly organized in tabular records.
The tabular screen of Huawei MatePad makes it perfect for reading comics.
Ancient Chinese bronze mirrors had surprisingly tabular surfaces.
Bilibili's bullet chat statistics are displayed in tabular layouts.
The Douban movie rating system uses tabular comparison charts.
The tabular mountaintop in Zhangjiajie looks like a giant's dining table.
Farmers grow tea on the tabular terraces of Yunnan.
The AI tabulates Douyin user data into colorful charts.
Archaeologists tabulate findings like ancient Excel users.
3D printers tabulate liquid resin into smooth layers.
The machine tabulates crumpled paper for recycling.
The tabulate coral fossil looks like a honeycomb pancake.
His tabulate phone case doubles as a mini desk.
Weibo hot searches are displayed as tabulated data.

examples.sentence: The census data was tabulated on bamboo slips in Han Dynasty.
She tabulated all Mahjong scores with emoji annotations.
The tabulated results reveal 73% of students sneak snacks into class.
The tabulation of exam scores took three pandas eating bamboo breaks.
Ancient accountants did tabulation on clay tablets â€“ the original Excel spreadsheet.
This tabulation shows how many milk teas were sacrificed for the project.
The tabulation of Dynasty Warriors KO counts looks like a phone number.
Data tabulation is the reason why spreadsheets exist â€“ to make accountants cry less.
Drinking three cups of boba tea triggered my tachycardia.
The athlete's tachycardia reached 200 BPM during the marathon.
The tacit old man communicated through handwritten notes.
Japanese salarymen often appear tacit during morning commutes.
Her tacit expression during the stand-up comedy confused the performers.
The panda keeper maintains a tacit demeanor despite the cubs' antics.
There was tacit agreement not to mention the failed hotpot experiment.
His tacit refusal to comment spoke louder than words.
The boss's tacit approval led to more casual Fridays.
There's a tacit understanding that the last dumpling belongs to grandma.
